title: External packages cannot access dependencies in spec
body:
I'm trying to register `py-numpy` as an external package, but when I try to install it, it crashes saying that `python` is not in the spec.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Register `py-numpy` as an external package
2. Install `py-numpy`

### Error Message

```console
$ spack --debug install py-numpy
==> py-numpy@1.14.2 : has external module in bwpy/1.2.4
==> py-numpy@1.14.2 : is actually installed in /opt/bwpy
==> py-numpy@1.14.2 : generating module file
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/bin/spack", line 54, in <module>
    sys.exit(spack.main.main())
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 653, in main
    return _invoke_command(command, parser, args, unknown)
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 432, in _invoke_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/install.py", line 273, in install
    install_spec(args, kwargs, spec)
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/install.py", line 154, in install_spec
    spec.package.do_install(**kwargs)
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1380, in do_install
    return self._process_external_package(explicit)
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1302, in _process_external_package
    spack.hooks.post_install(self.spec)
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/hooks/__init__.py", line 73, in __call__
    hook(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/hooks/module_file_generation.py", line 48, in <lambda>
    post_install = lambda spec: _for_each_enabled(spec, 'write')
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/hooks/module_file_generation.py", line 41, in _for_each_enabled
    getattr(generator, method_name)()
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/modules/common.py", line 698, in write
    context = self.context.to_dict()
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/tengine.py", line 86, in to_dict
    d = [(name, getattr(self, name)) for name in self.context_properties]
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/modules/common.py", line 553, in environment_modifications
    self.spec.package.setup_environment(_, env)
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/py-numpy/package.py", line 159, in setup_environment
    
  File "/mnt/a/u/sciteam/stewart1/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 2817, in __getitem__
    raise KeyError("No spec with name %s in %s" % (name, self))
KeyError: 'No spec with name python in py-numpy@1.14.2%cce@8.4.6+blas+lapack arch=cray-cnl5-interlagos'
```
The problem is that the `py-numpy` package contains the following `setup_environment`:
```python
    def setup_environment(self, spack_env, run_env):
        python_version = self.spec['python'].version.up_to(2)

        include_path = join_path(
            self.prefix.lib,
            'python{0}'.format(python_version),
            'site-packages',
            'numpy/core/include')

        run_env.prepend_path('CPATH', include_path)
```
When creating a module file, Spack queries the `python` version. But dependencies don't seem to make it into the `spec` for external packages, causing the `KeyError`.

@alalazo
